content.title: Matru Jyothi - Financial Assistance For PwD Mothers
content.department: Department of Social Justice, Government of Kerala
content.details: The scheme 'Matru Jyothi - Financial Assistance for PwD Mothers' was launched by the Department of Social Justice, Government of Kerala. Under the scheme, financial assistance of ₹2,000/- will be provided to differently-abled mothers coming under the purview of the Rights of Persons with Disabilities (RPwD) Act 2016. As per the scheme, financial assistance will be provided to differently-abled mothers until the child turns two years for the nurturing of the baby after delivery and for the preparation of basic amenities.
benefits: Financial assistance of ₹2,000/- will be provided to differently-abled mothers until the child turns two years.
eligibility: The applicant with the following type of disability will be considered under the scheme: Blindness (80%), Intellectual disability (60%), Cerebral Palsy (60%), Locomotor disability (80%), Muscular dystrophy (50%), Mental Illness (60%), Multiple disabilities (50%), Acid attack victims (80%), Autism spectrum disorder (50%), Low vision (70%), Deaf and Hard of hearing (70%), Chronic Neurological condition (70%), Leprosy cured person (80%), Multiple sclerosis (60%), Parkinson's disease (60%), Hemophilia (70%), Thalassemia (70%), Sickle cell disease (70%), Speech and language disability (80%), Dwarfism (70%), Specific learning disability (100%).
The applicant should be a native and resident of Kerala State.
The applicant should be a differently abled mother.
The differently abled mother who has a child less than two years old is eligible to apply under the scheme.
The applicant’s annual family income should not exceed ₹1,00,000/-.
content.application_process: Online and Offline. To avail of the benefits of the scheme, the applicant needs to visit SUNEETHI- Online Service Application Portal.
documents_required: Income certificate (If the applicant belongs to the BPL category, copy of the Ration card)
